attributes.magic: PE32 executable (GUI) Intel 80386, for MS Windows

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects when a file with a suspicious extension is created in the startup folder
A General detection for files being created in the Windows startup directory. This could be an indicator of persistence.

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Felix Bilstein - yara-signator at cocacoding dot com

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: The sample is ransomware, likely from the 'HERMES' family, as indicated by the string "HERMES" in the file encryption routine. Its behavior includes deleting Volume Shadow Copies and backup files to prevent recovery, using commands like 'vssadmin Delete Shadows /all /quiet' and 'del /s /f /q c:\\*.bak'. It encrypts user files, avoiding critical system directories, and drops a ransom note named 'DECRYPT_INFORMATION.html'. The malware also establishes persistence by creating a batch file in the Startup folder.
